sec.p: We found an effect of site ( Z = −3.43, df = 23, 18, P = 0.0006) and date ( Z = 2.91, df = 21, 20, P = 0.004), but not year ( Z = −1.25, df = 23, 18, P = 0.21). Average FCM levels of Atigun females were 4.5 times lower at gestation and 1.5 times lower at weaning than Toolik females (Fig. 3). At both sites, FCM levels increased from gestation to weaning (Atigun: 233 ± 47 ng/g to 942 ± 201 ng/g, Toolik: 1025 ± 212 ng/g to 1366 ± 163 ng/g; Fig. 3).

div.p: The glucocorticoid levels (fecal cortisol metabolites ng/g, mean ± SE) of adult female arctic ground squirrels at mid-gestation (10–14 d after conception) and at weaning at Atigun (light blue) and Toolik (dark red) sites in northern Alaska.
